Posts.Content: Kelsklo98 wrote: Hi my name is Rosie, I'm 38 and have 3 beautiful children. I'm so happy to have found this forum where we can post our fears so here I go: Last December I was having a lot of pain on my right breast went to my general doctor and she recommended for me to get mammogram which came back that I have excess tissue(forgot what it's called) the doctor didn't tell me to go for anymore testing a so I let it go and dealt with the pain (wrong choice). About a 2 weeks ago I felt a lump under my right arm pit and was worried so last week speaking to my partner I told him I was worried because it's the same side where I have been having pain, so he told me to make an appointment which I did. While getting ready to see my obgyn since I was disappointed with my general Doctor and my OB is very thorough. I decided to do a self breast exam RED FLAG I found a lump just above my nipple it's not a perfect lump. My doctor confirmed both lumps and now I'm waiting for another mammogram and ultrasound and I'M SCARED beyond belief. I keep reading about everything. I don't know how to make my fears go down. They don't have any appointments until te 15th of his month so the wait is so nerve reckoning. I don't know if it's wise to plan for the worst just in case or just wait and take it from there. My nipple seems to be more inverted, I have lost weight (maybe from stress). Any advice would be greatly appreciated. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Terrified!!! Kelsklo98 MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Oct 15, 2015 06:48PM Kelsklo98 wrote: thank you ladies. It was a diagnostic mammogram and an ultra sound. My concern is that he doctor tells me it a mass and just to keep doing my self monthly check and if it gets bigger to go back. She said because I have excess tissue that it can cause some tissue to become lumps. Now my thing is why she say IF IT GETS BIGGER, like REALLY!!
